articleList.title: Moon soil to head for Chairman Mao's hometown
articleList.excerpt: With Chang'e-5 probe making a perfect conclusion to its 23-day journey to the moon, bringing back soil from Earth's celestial neighbor, Central China's Hunan Province, the hometown of the late Chinese leader Mao Zedong, will be one of the sites where the moon samples are stored, to commemorate the leader and his passion for space exploration, China National Space Administration (CNSA) said on Thursday.

articleList.title: The 3rd World Laureates Forum opens in Shanghai, emphasizes global cooperation in fight against COVID-19
articleList.excerpt: The importance of science development and cooperation between all people seems unprecedentedly apparent this year, as the world witnesses how global scientists work together amid the COVID-19 pandemic, in curing patients and developing vaccines, top scientists worldwide pointed out on Friday.

articleList.title: China to promote development of global IPR governance
articleList.excerpt: China seeks to strengthen its cooperation with the World Intellectual Property Organization and other countries to achieve deeper participation in global intellectual property governance, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Hua Chunying said on Thursday.

articleList.title: Arid environments buzz with more bees, says study
articleList.excerpt: Researchers have mapped the distribution of bee species to study the size and diversity of their global population.

articleList.title: China develops electric-hub driverless tractor
articleList.excerpt: An agricultural machinery innovation center in China has developed a prototype of an electric-hub driverless tractor.

articleList.title: China launches 1st lunar sample return mission, aims for multiple breakthroughs in aerospace history
articleList.excerpt: The Long March-5 Y5, China's state-of-the-art carrier rocket and strongest member of the Long March launch vehicle family, blasted off early Tuesday morning from the Wenchang Space Launch Center located in South China's Hainan Province, successfully sending the Chang'e-5 lunar probe into planned orbit.

articleList.title: China launches Chang’e-5 mission via Long March-5 rocket to retrieve Moon rocks
articleList.excerpt: China launches Chang’e-5 mission via Long March-5 rocket to retrieve Moon rocks.

articleList.title: How two companies sprinted ahead in search for a cure
articleList.excerpt: Researchers race to design a vaccine to stop a pandemic in its tracks in less than a year.

articleList.title: Digital banks race to capture the next generation
articleList.excerpt: When John Hibbs' daughter Xanthe received her first bank card in the mail, the six-year-old spent the next week Googling how to buy a horse.

articleList.title: Anti-depression drug fluvoxamine can prevent deterioration of mild COVID-19 infections, research shows
articleList.excerpt: None of the 80 infected subjects who received fluvoxamine treatment for 15 days experienced deterioration in their health, while six persons in the placebo group all suffered deterioration, according to the research.

articleList.title: Country's best energy option
articleList.excerpt: The Western civilisation since Industrial Revolution two and a half centuries ago has been thriving on fossil fuel-powered machines. And commercial production of electricity with coal-fired generators began around one and a half centuries ago.

articleList.title: Beijing-Zhangjiakou line unveils smart railway system era
articleList.excerpt: China’s first self-driving high speed railway linking the two host cities of the 2022 Winter Olympic Games went into operation on Monday, featuring cutting-edge homegrown technologies deemed as major breakthroughs regarding China’s rail development. The new line also demonstrated the country’s railway evolution.

articleList.title: Canada seeks $630 million from streaming firms to fund domestic content
articleList.excerpt: Canada introduced a bill that would strengthen the broadcast regulator and allow it to collect up to C$830 million ($630 million) by 2023 from online streaming companies such as Netflix and Amazon to fund Canadian content.

articleList.title: The 3rd World Laureates Forum opens in Shanghai, emphasizes global cooperation in fight against COVID-19
articleList.excerpt: The importance of science development and cooperation between all people seems unprecedentedly apparent this year, as the world witnesses how global scientists work together amid the COVID-19 pandemic, in curing patients and developing vaccines, top scientists worldwide pointed out on Friday.

articleList.title: Chinese scientific researchers gain more global recognition
articleList.excerpt: Chinese scientists and social scientists exceeded those from the UK in terms of citations, coming second in the list of 2019 Highly Cited Researchers following the US, which Chinese researchers said is a result of the country’s decades of heavy investment in scientific research.

articleList.title: Successful satellite tests to allow ‘Hongyun speed’ by 2020
articleList.excerpt: The demonstration system for China’s Hongyun Project, a low-orbit broadband communication satellite system, will become operational at the beginning of 2020, making substantial progress toward the eventual goal of providing internet connectivity to users around the world, developers told the Global Times on Tuesday.

articleList.title: Chinese AI company Pensees opens Singapore Institute
articleList.excerpt: Beijing-based Artificial Intelligence (AI) company Pensees Technology Co Ltd (Pensees) opened here its Singapore Institute Wednesday to oversee the development of its applied industrial R&D and delivery capabilities in Singapore and the region.

articleList.title: NASA's TESS mission discovers three new worlds
articleList.excerpt: NASA's newest planet hunter, the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS), has discovered three new worlds -- one slightly larger than Earth and two of a type not found in our solar system -- orbiting a nearby star, according to the US space agency.

articleList.title: Tesla faces scrutiny
articleList.excerpt: The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) on Wednesday cited driver errors and Tesla Inc's Autopilot design as the probable causes of a Model S crash in January 2018. The car, which was operating in Autopilot mode, crashed into a parked fire truck on a highway in California early last year.

articleList.title: Exhibition of Chinese arts students in Serbia shows changes in urban, rural China
articleList.excerpt: Visitors view photos during the photo exhibition

articleList.excerpt: With Chang'e-5 probe making a perfect conclusion to its 23-day journey to the moon, bringing back soil from Earth's celestial neighbor, Central China's Hunan Province, the hometown of the late Chinese leader Mao Zedong, will be one of the sites where the moon samples are stored, to commemorate the leader and his passion for space exploration, China National Space Administration (CNSA) said on Thursday.
